messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics]  finding my passions....

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/1/2006 2:10:19 AM Eastern Standard Time,
unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes:

>Barbara has a new book out, Refuse to Choose! A Revolutionary Program
for Doing Everything That You Love.>

Where can I find this book? I'd love to read it!



*******************
Got mine at Amazon. It's AMAZING! I think Barbara's books are great for
unschoolers...it reminds us grownups that we get to have wonderful lives too.
Kathryn

Program for

far it feels

Scanners -- people
> who have many interests and passions.
>

raised
> unschoolers. One of the things I love about her is her emphasis on
your NOT having
> to become "a better person" before you can have your dreams.

>

I just read about it on Amazon when I went to check on the link.
I am "so" a scanner.
Is it worth buying?
Our library doen't have it yet.

Kiersten

messages.subject: Re: finding my passions....
messages.msgSnippet: I Could  Do Anything If I Only Knew What It Was by Barbara Sher has step by step  exercises to figure out what you might enjoy and how to use baby steps to
messages.messageBody:
"I Could Do Anything If I Only Knew What It Was" by Barbara Sher has
step by step exercises to figure out what you might enjoy and how to
use baby steps to actually TRY new things.

I think it is a great read.

I hope you have fun exploring all kinds of new things now that all 3
are out of school! I can only imagine how weird that must feel at this
point.

Kiersten

~"I Could Do Anything If I Only Knew What It Was" by Barbara Sher~

Oh yes. I also loved her book "Wishcraft". Helped me a lot at the time.

Ren



*************************
Barbara has a new book out, Refuse to Choose! A Revolutionary Program for
Doing Everything That You Love. I haven't read all of it, but so far it feels
like an Unschooler's Bible. She describes what she calls Scanners -- people
who have many interests and passions.

I think Barbara has a handle on adult unschoolers who weren't raised
unschoolers. One of the things I love about her is her emphasis on your NOT having
to become "a better person" before you can have your dreams.

She's very cool.
Kathryn

Come to the Northeast Unschooling Conference, Memorial Day Weekend, May
26-28, 2006 in Peabody, Massachusetts! www.NortheastUnschoolingConference.com
